statements: UPDATE customers SET total_order_amount = 500.00, last_purchase_date = '2022-01-15' WHERE customer_id = 1

UPDATE customers SET total_order_amount = total_order_amount + 1000 WHERE customer_id = 1;
UPDATE customers SET customer_name = 'John Doe', last_purchase_date = '2023-01-15' WHERE customer_email = 'johndoe@email.com';
UPDATE Customers SET age = 30, city = 'New York' WHERE customer_id = 1;
UPDATE Orders SET total_amount = 1500.00, order_date = '2022-09-15' WHERE order_id = 101;
UPDATE Customers SET name='John Doe', age=30, city='New York' WHERE customer_id=123;
UPDATE Orders SET total_amount=1000.50, order_date='2023-08-15' WHERE customer_id=456;
UPDATE customers SET customer_name = 'John Doe', email = 'john.doe@example.com' WHERE customer_id = 1;
UPDATE purchases SET product_name = 'Laptop', total_amount = 1500.00 WHERE purchase_id = 101;
UPDATE customers SET email = 'newemail@example.com', phone_number = '+1234567890' WHERE customer_id = 1;

UPDATE customers SET total_spent = 5000.00 WHERE customer_id = 101;
UPDATE transactions SET product_name = 'Laptop' WHERE transaction_id = 201;
UPDATE customers SET total_spent = total_spent + 500 WHERE customer_id = 123
UPDATE purchases SET total_price = quantity * 10 WHERE transaction_id = 456
